snippet: Energy policy, trade disputes with China and relations with Israel were among the subjects where the facts were more nuanced than assertions made during the debate.
abstract: Check Point column evaluates the veracity of statements made by Pres Obama and Mitt Romney during the second presidential debate.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER, JOHN M. BRODER, SHARON LaFRANIERE, RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr., RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and JULIA PRESTON

lead_paragraph: Energy policy, trade disputes with China and relations with Israel were among the subjects where the facts were more nuanced than assertions made during the debate.

headline.print_headline: A Closer Look at Some of the More Hotly Disputed Assertions
headline.seo: A Closer Look at Some Disputed Claims
headline.main: A Closer Look at Some of the More Hotly Disputed Assertions
